title: 'None of Your Damn Business' Review: A Right to Be Let Alone
summary: A legal historian examines how changing technologies and cultural values shaped our expectations of privacy in American life.. The word "privacy" appears nowhere in our Constitution, but privacy lies at the root of our constitutional republic. At least that is how John Adams saw it on the day before America declared independence. Writing to his wife, Abigail, on July 3, 1776, Adams observed that the path to independence traced back to "the year 1761," specifically to "the argument concerning writs of assistance." Fifteen years before, Adams witnessed a trial in Boston challenging British searches and seizures licensed by broad "writs"-warrants-issued by the king. He even memorialized lawyer James Otis's case against them: "One of the most essential branches of English liberty is the freedom of one's house," Adams summarized at the time. "A man's house is his castle; and whilst he is quiet, he is as well guarded as a prince in his castle."

title: How Elizabeth Strout Brought Cantankerous Olive Kitteridge Back Again
summary: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author on her new book 'Olive, Again' and reentering the small-town life of Crosby, Maine. Prickly but charming, stubborn but open to change, stingy but generous, Olive Kitteridge, with all her nuances and contradictions, can be summed up thusly: "She didn't like to be alone. Even more, she didn't like being with people."

title: China's Crackdown on Risky Deposits Ignores Structural Problem
summary: Authorities are cracking down on structured deposits, but they are ignoring the reasons they are so appealing to banks and customers. A twist on traditional bank deposits has become wildly popular in China. Authorities are reining it in, once again treating the financial system's symptoms without addressing the disease.

title: Inside Boris Johnson's Brexit Gamble
summary: U.K. prime minister's hard-ball tactics helped seal a deal. Now the battle moves to Parliament.. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson played an elaborate game of bluff to strike a Brexit deal with Europe . He is now trying to finish his gambit on the home front.

title: Former Third Avenue Management CEO Moves Into Indexes
summary: David Barse's XOUT Capital designs indexes and licenses them to money managers; 'The ultimate goal is to outperform.'. David Barse, whose long career as chief executive of Third Avenue Management LLC unraveled in the final weeks of 2015, is back on Wall Street pitching a better way to invest in indexes.

title: Made in Taiwan: Seeds of Future Bond-Market Volatility
summary: South Korea, Japan and Taiwan's holdings of U.S. dollar corporate bonds have more than doubled in the past five years. Asia's insurance behemoths, particularly in Taiwan, pose a growing risk to the U.S. corporate-bond market after a multiyear binge on greenback debt.

title: Washington Fans-Old and New-Gather on the Nationals' Stage
summary: Resume Subscription. Jim Denbo has waited more than 70 years to see a Washington, D.C., baseball team reach the World Series. He is unabashedly giddy as his beloved Nationals prepare to take on the Houston Astros for the championship starting Tuesday evening.

title: U.S. Ambassador to China Defends Restrictions on Beijing's Diplomats as Overdue
summary: Terry Branstad calls the move a step toward reciprocity. BEIJING-U.S. Ambassador to China Terry Branstad rejected Beijing's criticism of increased regulations on Chinese diplomats in the U.S., calling Washington's move a long overdue step toward reciprocity.

title: NBA Lets Teams Take Sponsors Abroad as International Push Continues
summary: League's jersey patch sponsorship program inspired expanded global initiative. When the NBA regular season begins Tuesday, each team will be able to work with up to two sponsors on advertising campaigns outside the U.S. and Canada, an expansion of the league's global marketing activity fueled in part by the results of its separate, two-year-old jersey sponsorship program.

title: As Court Case Imperils ACA, Some States Prepare a Contingency
summary: Lawmakers explore ways to preserve coverage, benefits if the health law is struck down. A federal appeals court decision that could strike down the Affordable Care Act as soon as this month has rattled officials in several states who are pursuing legislation to preserve some coverage in the absence of any Trump administration contingency plan.

title: Exxon's Climate-Change Accounting Goes on Trial
summary: New York's attorney general says the oil giant misled investors about its calculations of future climate-change regulation. Exxon Mobil Corp. and New York's attorney general are headed for a showdown this week over accusations the company deceived investors, a rare trial over how the oil industry accounts for the impact of climate change.

title: Find Your Zen, Then Crush Your Job Interview
summary: Discovering offbeat ways to center yourself can put you in the perfect frame of mind when meeting a prospective employer. The hours before a job interview can feel like torture. How can you spend that time in a way that enables you to arrive calm and centered?

title: Protests in Chile Leave Eight Dead, Capital and Five Provinces Under State of Emergency
summary: The government is responding to the tumult with police, soldiers and armored vehicles. SANTIAGO, Chile-Protests, looting and arson in what had until now been Latin America's most prosperous and stable country led to eight deaths Sunday, with the violence spreading beyond the capital even after President Sebastián Piñera said that the increase in subway fares that sparked the unrest would be canceled.

title: Count Turns Controversial in Bolivian Presidential Race
summary: Supreme Electoral Tribunal stops publicly updating tally after preliminary results show incumbent Evo Morales will face a runoff. Bolivian's leftist president, Evo Morales, took the most ballots in Sunday's election-but apparently not enough to avoid a runoff that could push him from power after nearly 14 years.

title: Trump Weighs Leaving Small Number of Troops in Syria
summary: The plan is designed to protect oil fields and keep a foothold against Islamic State. WASHINGTON-President Trump is considering whether to keep a few hundred U.S. troops in northeast Syria after the bulk of the American force leaves, a move that would be another twist in years of policy gyrations over the country, according to U.S. officials.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Australian Newspapers Redact Front Pages in Call for Press Freedoms
summary: Media companies are campaigning for legal changes, including the right to contest search warrants. SYDNEY-Newspaper front pages across Australia were blacked out Monday, as the country's biggest media companies are calling on Canberra to enshrine press freedoms and protect whistleblowers.

title: Manulife Investment Unit Hires Houlihan Lokey Executives
summary: Firm brings two senior executives brought on to build new secondary platform. Manulife Investment Management, the investment arm of Toronto-based insurer Manulife Financial Corp., is expanding into one of the fastest-growing corners of the private-equity industry.
